content: Hi, welcome! I am a PhD candidate at the Swiss Finance Institute and University of Zurich. During my PhD, I worked on derivative and bond markets, bank capital and leverage regulations, as well as on the impact of FinTech on traditional banking. Previously, I was a consultant at Frontier Economics in London, where I specialized in Financial Services. Outside work, I enjoy martial arts and beautiful hikes.

title: Andrada Bilan
Trading Frictions in Credit Derivatives and Bond Squeezes

authors: with Luciana Barbosa and Claire Celerier
summary: SFS Cavalcade 2019, FIRS 2019, EFA 2017 ECB Lamfalussy Fellowship
title: Capital Inflows and Skill (Mis)allocation: Evidence from Portugal

authors: with Steven Ongena (UZH), Hans Degryse (Leuven) and Kuchulain O'Flynn (UZH)
summary: This book outlines in detail the transition from traditional to modern banking. In six different chapters, we explore the effects of increased financial sophistication on a dimension of the loan contract: amount, interest rate, credit risk, collateral, currency, and lending technology. For each of these dimensions, we study the impact of sophisticated finance: securitization, interest rate hedging, credit risk hedging, patent collateral, foreign exchange, and fintech. We evaluate the economic benefits and costs of this new financial ecosystem, by relying on recent empirical research in banking and finance.
title: Banking and Financial Markets: How Financial Technology is Reshaping the Banking Market?

authors: with Diana Bonfim (BoP), Steven Ongena (UZH) and Alexandro Ruiz (CEMFI)

title: Lending Conditions after a Liquidity Shock

title: Applications in Banking: Securitization and Global Banking
